notesStmt.note: Marginal notes in red appear to be by same hand as three exempla added on fol. 103r; early parchment flyleaves
De Ricci, Seymour, with the assistance of W. J. Wilson, Census of Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the United States and Canada, vol. 2 (New York,: H. W. Wilson, 1935-40), p. 2045, no. 116.

Free Library of Philadelphia, A Descriptive Catalogue of the John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts in the Free Library of Philadelphia, compiled by Edwin Wolf, 2nd, with an introduction by Dr. A.S.W. Rosenbach (Philadelphia: The Free Library, 1937), p. 7-8, no. 4.

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This book contains the text of the Hexameron, a commentary by Ambrose of Milan on the biblical account of the six days of Creation. In red ink at the end of the text, the scribe Guglielmo de Cruces wrote a colophon giving himself credit for finishing the book in 1468 and stating that the copy was destined for use in the Carthusian monastery of Montello in Treviso. The text is followed by three short exempla written in a different hand, drawn from Hugh of Grenoble's De vero iudicio iudicando, the Thesaurus pauperum, and the Exposition of Alan of Lisle on Matthew 26.

msItem.title: Hexameron
msItem.author: Ambrose of Milan
msItem.colophon: Fol. 102v: "Explicit exameron beati ambrosii episcopi. Iste liber est domus montelli ordinis cartusie dyocesis tarusine. Scriptus per me fratrem guilliem de cruce. Professum eiusdem domus 1468."

msItem.title: Ambrose of Milan, Hexameron
msItem.incipit: Tantum ne opinionis assumpsisse homines… [fol. Ir]
msItem.explicit: cui est honor gloria perpetuitas a seculis, et nunc et semper et in omnia secula seculorum. Amen. [fol. CIIIv]

msItem.title: Excerpt from Hugh of Grenoble, De vero iudicio iudicando
msItem.incipit: Legitur in legenda sancti hugonis grenonpolitani

msItem.title: Excerpt from the Thesaurus pauperum
msItem.incipit: Legitur etiam in libro qui dicitur thesaurus pauperum…

msItem.title: Exposition of Alan of Lisle on Matthew 26

supportDesc.extent: ii+103+ii; 182 x 126 mm bound to 192 x 136 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Contemporary foliation in roman numerals, upper right recto

layoutDesc.layout: One of column of thirty-three to thirty-four lines, hard point ruling; one-to-four-line initials in red throughout; running titles in red; written area: 127 x 79 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: IrFour line red pen initial T

binding.p: Early twentieth century, parchment over pasteboard, gilt line border on edges, gold stamped spine with false raised bands, written in gold HEXAMERON AMBROSII M.S. 1468

history.provenance: Montello, diocese of Treviso, [olim ms. n. 10] (after 1469; in addition to colophon on 102v, fol. 1 contains inscription: "Domus montelli ordinis cartusie dyocesis tarusie. N. 10"); sold Anderson & Co., New York (December 6, 1920, no. 279); G. Michelmore, bookseller, London; resold by American Art Association, New York (January 30, 1923, no. 434); John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936
